sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A song on a lady's drinking Lansdowne, George Granville, Baron, 1667-1735.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : music.
s.n., [London : 1700?]
Caption title ; without imprint. Attributed to George Granville Landsdowne. Cf. Wing (2nd ed.). Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). For voice and continuo (figured bass) ; with a version for the flute. No. "32" located on the top right-hand corner of sheet. First Iine: "Whilst Phillis is driving, love and wine in alliance with forces united ; bides resistless defiance." Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======
